para: This filter is used to "fix" unreliable GPS data by discarding points that are believed to be unreliable. You may specify an HDOP and/or VDOP above a specified limit, a minimum number of satellites that must have been in view for a fix to be considered, or both.

HDOP and VDOP are measures of the best possible horizontal or vertical precision for a given configuration of GPS satellites. Higher numbers indicate a higher dilution of precision and therefore mathematically less useful.

example.title: Using the discard filter for HDOP and VDOP.

para.userinput: gpsbabel -i gpx -f in.gpx -x discard,hdop=10,vdop=20,hdopandvdop -o gpx -F out.gpx

para: You may specify a minimum number of satellites.

example.title: Using the discard filter to require at least three satellites.

para.userinput: gpsbabel -i gpx -f in.gpx -x discard,sat=3 -o gpx -F out.gpx

para: Contributed by Tobias Minich and Serge Droz.
